'''Combusken''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ワカシャモ''' ''Wakasyamo'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Fighting}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Torchic}} starting at [[level]] 16 and evolves into {{p|Blaziken}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Combusken is a bipedal, chicken-like Pokémon. Most of Combusken's upper body is yellow, while most of the lower body is orange. An orange, pointed design adorns the center of its waist at the dividing line of the two colors. It has orange eyes and short, wide beak. There is a feather crest on top of its head with three orange points. This crest is smaller on female Combusken. Its tail is short and pointed. It has three, sharp claws at the ends of its long arms, and scaly, gray legs with well-developed thighs covered in shaggy feathers. Because of the training Combusken does by running through its {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grassland}} habitat, these legs are capable of delivering a barrage of kicks. While it is fighting, it is noisy and produces sharp cries that distract and intimidate its opponent.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:May Combusken.png|thumb|left|220px|Combusken in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[May's Combusken]]=====
{{an|May}}'s Torchic evolved into a Combusken in ''[[AG082|A Shroomish Skirmish]]'', and then into a {{p|Blaziken}} in ''[[AG191|Once More with Reeling!]]''

=====Other=====
Combusken debuted in ''[[AG034|Having a Wailord of a Time]]''. The [[Nurse Joy]] of [[Slateport City]] was keeping a Torchic, {{p|Treecko}}, and {{p|Mudkip}} for a girl who was going to start being a {{pkmn|Trainer}}. The Torchic evolved and had to be hidden. After the Combusken saved a {{p|Wailord}}, Nurse Joy decided to keep it as a guard for her [[Pokémon Center]].

====Minor appearances====
A Combusken appeared in a flashback in ''[[SS023|Pokémon Ranger: Guardian Signs (Part Two)]]''.

Two Trainers' Combusken appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer===
A Combusken appeared in the [[Pokémon Omega Ruby and Pokémon Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer]], under the ownership of {{ga|May}}. It evolved from {{p|Torchic}} and later evolved into {{p|Blaziken}}, which was capable of [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolving]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Chic Combusken.png|thumb|150px|Combusken in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Chic}}
{{adv|Sapphire}}'s Torchic that she received from her father, [[Professor Birch]], evolved into a Combusken before her challenge of Gym Leader [[Brawly]] in ''[[PS195|Mashing Makuhita]]'', and won against his {{TP|Brawly|Hariyama}} even after her partner [[Rono]] had nearly collapsed. After undergoing much training and being used against fights against the likes of [[Team Aqua]] and in friendly bouts against [[Flannery]], she evolved again to a Blaziken battling [[Winona]], though she failed to win.

Multiple Combusken were used by {{tc|Team Galactic Grunt}}s in ''[[PS424|Exit Empoleon]]''.

==Trivia==
* Combusken begins a tradition of Fire/Fighting starter evolutions that would persist through Generations IV and V.

===Origin===
Combusken is probably based on a {{wp|cockfighting}} chicken. Combusken may also be based on the {{wp|basan}}, a fire-breathing chicken.

====Name origin====
Combusken is a combination of ''combustion'' and ''{{wp|chicken}}''. It may also involve ''combat''.

Wakasyamo is a combination of 若い ''wakai'' (young) and 軍鶏 ''{{wp|Shamo (chicken)|shamo}}'' (a breed of Japanese chicken once raised for fighting).
